alert.note: Alert for Central Coast; North Coast (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued January 10 at 2:40AM PST until January 10 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM THIS MORNING TO 1 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the High Surf Warning, dangerously large breaking waves around 20 feet in the surf zone. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding expected. Inundation of 2 feet above ground level is possible along shorelines and low-lying coastal areas around the time of high tide. * WHERE...North Coast and Central Coast zones. * WHEN...For the High Surf Warning, until 1 PM PST Wednesday. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 7 AM to 1 PM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor coastal flooding due to tidal overflow is expected around high tide. This may lead to flooding of parking lots, parks, and roads, with only isolated road closures expected. Destructive breaking waves can sweep people off jetties and docks, and into dangerous seas. People can be swept off rocks, jetties, and logs and drown while observing high surf. Life-threatening surf conditions and significant beach erosion can be expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High waves continuing through high tide today and continuing onshore flow is enhancing the coastal flooding threat.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inundation above ground level refers to the height above the Mean Higher High Water (MHHW) level. Everyone should remain out of the water due to life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of jetties, piers, and other waterside infrastructure.
